message.content:
cs.CV, cs.CR, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.DC

Reasoning: 
1. cs.CV (Computer Vision): The paper focuses on developing a real-time surveillance system using video features extracted by a Deep Machine Learning (DML) model. The use of computer vision techniques to analyze video data makes it highly likely that this paper belongs to the cs.CV sub-category.
2. cs.CR (Cryptography and Security): The paper discusses a surveillance strategy for identifying suspicious activities, which is a security-related application. The use of fuzzy decision making and Microservices architecture to enhance security also supports the possibility of this paper belonging to the cs.CR sub-category.
3. cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence): The paper proposes a fuzzy control system to mimic the decision-making process of a security officer. The use of AI techniques to develop a surveillance system makes it likely that this paper belongs to the cs.AI sub-category.
4. cs.LG (Machine Learning): The paper uses a Deep Machine Learning (DML) model to extract video features for decision making. The use of machine learning techniques to develop a surveillance system makes it possible that this paper belongs to the cs.LG sub-category.
5. cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing): The paper leverages the Microservices architecture to enhance scalability, which is a distributed computing technique. The use of distributed computing techniques to develop a surveillance system makes it possible that this paper belongs to the cs.DC sub-category
